name: Healthyfied Vegetable Tamarind Miso Sinigang (Sour soup)
description: Indulge in the unique blend of tangy and umami flavors with our Healthyfied Vegetable Tamarind Miso Sinigang. Perfect for anyone looking for low-sodium, hearty, and health-conscious options, this sour soup is a delicious take on a classic Filipino favorite, making it a must-try for any health-conscious individual.

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the vegetables: slice the eggplant, radish, and finely chop the garlic and red onion. Cut the green chili in half.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Boil the tamarind pulp in 2 cups of water for about 15 minutes to extract the juice, then strain it to remove the seeds and husks.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot, bring 6 cups of water to a boil, then add the strained tamarind juice, garlic, onion, and green chili. Let it simmer for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sliced eggplant and radish to the pot and cook until they are tender, about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in yellow miso paste until well combined, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Finally, add the spinach and let it wilt in the hot soup, about 2 minutes before turning off the heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6
